shortDescription: Aggressors are attacking our famine relief effort on This Planet. If they succeed, mass starvation will follow. They're trying to bait me into redirecting the main army and taking the field myself… but I can't let them do that. If our people are to survive, you will have to save them.
longDescription: We had to deal with hunger back home. Stealing food from starving people is low.

contractObjectiveList.title: Protect the spaceport's command center from the Agressors advance
Prevent the Agressors from seizing Planet Defense DropShips

objectiveList.title: Prevent Commando APCs from Reaching the Command Center
Stop the APC from Reaching the Barracks
Eliminate all APCs to Bring the Turrets Back Online

dialogueContent.words: This planet is in desperate shape, Commander. Famine is a fact of life here, and the Agressors have targeted the spaceport we've been using to deliver emergency supplies.

As we speak, the Agressors have several waves of APCs—complete with BattleMech escorts—en route to the spaceport's command center. If they succeed in taking it, they'll lock down our supply ships, and the people of this planet will starve.

The spaceport's turrets are down, and the defenders are in no position to repel an attack of this magnitude. It's on us to stop them. You will defend the spaceport against the agressors and prevent their troop transports from reaching the command center.

They're likely to send a detachment for our wounded as well, Commander. If you can spare a 'Mech or two, please consider sending them to protect our barracks. We've suffered too many casualties to defend ourselves.
You've done it, Commander—you've driven them off! And you've saved all of our lives. I'll see to it that this food gets distributed to the people who need it.
See that you do, Lieutenant. You should know… We can't promise that they won't be back.
Desperate times are nothing new for us—things have been grim since your uncle's coup, and we've made it this far. As long as you keep the supply shipments coming in, we'll find a way to hold out.
We are good to go.
Stop those transports, Commander.

The Agressors have been hitting us hard, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}—the 2nd is nearly gone. But I do still have a few noncombatant personnel left under my command, and we'll do what we can to defend the Plent.
If you can stop all of the Agressors APCs from reaching the command center, my people will get this spaceport's turrets up and running for you.
I'm afraid that we won't be able to make a move if any of them get through; I just don't have the numbers to go up against there infantry in a ground fight. Best of luck, Commander.
I'm picking up another Agressor transport, Commander. Destroy it.
I'm seeing another drop of a Agressor APC on radar.
All Agressor APCs are down, Commander! Hold tight—we're bringing the turrets online now!
The Agressors have just dropped a transport full of commandos! If they make it to our barracks, my injured soldiers are as good as dead. Please, Commander—stop them if you can!
An enemy transport is closing in on the command center! Stop it before it delivers its troops!
The Agressors are closing in on that barracks! If they take it, our wounded soldiers will be slaughtered!
Hurry, Commander! Get those turrets back online!
Keep pushing them back! Show the Agressors that we will never stop fighting!
Those transports cannot be allowed to take this spaceport! Whatever it takes, we must push them back!
It's too late, Commander. The barracks has been overrun. Right now, they're executing our enlisted troops and taking our officers for interrogation... I'm not sure which group has it worse.
Thank you for trying to save them. I know that you did everything you could.
You've done it, Commander—our people are safe, thanks to you. We'll never forget what you've done for us today.
